column4: Friends, I've problems with a NTFS partition with Windows XP, when i try to reboot the pc and select win xp the pc is restarted, I can't enter in win xp or mount the partition too
here is the output dor fdisk and fstab file => http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/19796
whats your grub menu entry to reboot into windows?
is the ntfs partition the one winxp is installed in (as i see you have fat partitions too)
also what error do you get when selecting winxp from the grub menu when trying to boot into it?
so you dont get any error message about not finding it or anything?
im afraid i dont speak (spanish is it?)
can you try and mount it, then straight after type in dmesg and pastebin what it says?
edit your fstab (after backing it up of course ;)) and change the windows (ntfs) parition line to: /dev/hda1 /media/hda1 ntfs nls=utf8,umask=0222 0 0
then try and mount it again
no problem, hope everything works out for you and sorry i couldnt be any more helpful

from the looks of your dmesg, the ntfs partition looks damaged/needing some sort of windows repair, it bails out after trying to mount and says it doesnt try to recover, now im not sure how to make it try and recover etc, sorry, have you searched/posted on the forums?

if you reinstall xp you will haver to make sure not to overwrite your linux partitions etc, once windows is installed then follow https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
but i would advise instead of reinstalling windows
boot up windows cd, goto recovery console, type in fixmbr, which will then auto boot windows, then follow the guide at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
